required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Alcohol Screening and Pre-Operative Intervention Research Study
clinical_study.official_title: Alcohol Screening and Pre-Operative Intervention Research Study

collaborator.agency: National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism (NIAAA)

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to learn more about how to improve patients' health before and after a scheduled surgery by examining acceptability and initial efficacy of pre-operative alcohol use reduction interventions.

detailed_description.textblock: The study is a randomized clinical pilot trial that assesses preliminary intervention efficacy of a two-session health coaching intervention relative to brief advice among pre-operative elective surgical patients and evaluates intervention acceptability. Study subjects will be outpatients at a large health system in the midwestern United States and fulfill the study's inclusion criteria. Subjects will be randomized to one of two intervention conditions: Health Coaching or Brief Advice.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Enrollment is temporarily paused due to COVID-19; interactions/interventions with current participants continue. This is not a suspension of IRB approval.

primary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of intervention as measured by change in alcohol use as measured by the alcohol timeline follow back
primary_outcome.description: Alcohol use (defined as average weekly drinking)

secondary_outcome.measure: Acceptability of intervention as measured by the post-intervention evaluation.
secondary_outcome.description: Interventions will be considered 'acceptable' if the average acceptability rating reaches a threshold of 4 or more on a 5-point Likert scale where a score of 5 is most acceptable.

arm_group.description: One brief advice session, resource brochure, standard of care, and an infographic about alcohol and surgical health at patient's pre-existing pre-operative clinical visit.
Two health coaching sessions, resource brochure, standard of care

intervention.description: Two 50-minute health coaching sessions will use a non-confrontation motivational interviewing (MI) style. Intervention delivery will include expressing concern about unhealthy drinking, providing feedback linking alcohol use and health (related to surgery and general health), advising the patient regarding abstinence or alcohol use reduction, and working with the patient to set a drinking goal if he/she is ready to change. We will also include a personalized feedback component to address the links between pre-operative alcohol use and postoperative morbidity/mortality.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Referred for elective or semi-elective surgery or pre-operative assessment in the next 120 days
- Meet criteria for "risky drinking" as defined by study staff
Exclusion Criteria:
- Displays or shows evidence of psychotic symptoms
- Undergoing surgeries that commonly require local anesthesia only

responsible_party.investigator_title: Assistant Professor of Psychiatry, Medical School

patient_data.ipd_description: The researchers will plan to share individual participant data that underlies the results reported in an article, after deidentification (text, tables, figures, and appendices), Study protocol, and Informed Consent Form.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Beginning 9 months and ending 36 months following article publication.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Investigators whose proposed use of the data has been approved by an independent review committee ("learned intermediary") identified for this purpose.
